name: Inboxish Gmail
description:
A bit more of an inbox feel to the "new" gmail (end of 2018, that is).  Nothing radical.  Just a very slight tweaking of positions, colors, and sizing.

Be gentle, it's my first style :)
additional_info: Developed because inbox is going away and I grew to like it. This makes gmail less jarring for me. Made on a Mojave dark-mode 5k desktop, running current Chrome. Gmail is set for: - default theme - default inbox - default density - 10 (or 15) messages per page I commented liberally and tried to keep !important to a minimum. I did have to use combination class selectors to keep elements specific enough for the style to work correctly. I know, I know, there are ways other than !important to make a selector more specific. I'm lazy. I kept gmail defaults as much possible. Filters are used to change the icon colors. There are two icons borrowed from inbox. Not entirely necessary. Also, webkit specific CSS is used to make the scrollbars match dark mode Mojave and change the color of placeholder text. Also not entirely necessary. But *I* like it :)
